In these categories of defenses, outliers of uploaded model updates (which we describe with the

in the proof) are likely to be considered as suspected attackers and those updates will be reprocessed (e.g., eliminated, purified, corrected) before aggregation. However, our attack ensures that poisoned models are close to the clique of benign ones. As practiced inÂ
, such a fundamental attack principle achieves good performance because it can seriously confuse defenses by avoiding making itself an outlier. Further,

searches the best-influential poisoned model in the neighborhood of the benign reference model, while the search distance is upper bounded by the maximum distance between any normally trained model (available to the attacker) and the reference model. We also provide the theoretical analysis of
